channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Blazing trails: Who’s setting fire to the Amazon?
This Week in Explainers: How the rumours of the demolition of the Eiffel Tower started
History Today: When Wall Street witnessed 'Black Monday', its biggest ever crash
Confused which cooking oil is healthier? Here's why you should pay attention to its origin
Major fire erupts at MPs' quarters near Parliament in Delhi. What happened?
Putin-Trump summit: Can the Russian leader travel to Hungary despite an ICC warrant?
How Chinese claims on Garhwal’s Barahoti are absurd, a result of India’s ‘good-boy’ syndrome
item.description: It is absurd that such a humble pastureland or ‘bowl’ has mobilised so many resources and defence manpower simply due to Chinese hegemonistic tendencies

item.title: Madagascar coup: How Indian Ocean Region has become a ring of instability
item.description: It is not about the size of the nations or their populations, but about a triggering issue that could bring the people to the streets

item.title: India and Mongolia: Spiritual partners in temporal world
item.description: The world is confronting new hegemonic challenges, where both nations share a common interest in peace and a multipolar global order

item.title: Beaten in Op Sindoor, JeM forms women’s brigade to target India
item.description: Operation Sindoor may have destroyed Jaish-e-Mohammed's stronghold, but the real battle now lies in dismantling the ideologies rising from its ashes

item.title: Recognising local units of global defence firms as 'Indian' will boost self-reliance
item.description: The move will help build a stronger military-industrial complex, cushion India from supply chain shocks, and shift the country from an import-heavy posture to a resilient and globally competitive defence ecosystem

item.title: Bangladesh must be saved from becoming the very Pakistan it broke away from
item.description: Bangladesh today stands at a defining moment—caught between the rise of Pakistan-style religious politics and a weakened democratic order
